DataElement.preferredName: FSFI 13 Past 4 Weeks Satisfaction Ability Reach Orgasm During Sexual Activity or Intercourse Score 6 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how satisfied they were in the past 4 weeks with their ability to reach orgasm (climax) during sexual activity or intercourse, using a 6 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Female Sexual Function Index Past 4 Weeks Satisfaction of Ability to Reach Orgasm During Sexual Activity or Intercourse Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A 19-item self-report questionnaire designed to measure sexual function in women. It was developed for assessing domains of sexual functioning (e.g. sexual arousal, orgasm, satisfaction, pain) in women participating in clinical trials for arousal disorders._A period of time consisting of the 28 days before the present._A question about how satisfied an individual is or was with the ability to reach orgasm or climax during sexual activity or intercourse._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A 19-item self-report questionnaire designed to measure sexual function in women. It was developed for assessing domains of sexual functioning (e.g. sexual arousal, orgasm, satisfaction, pain) in women participating in clinical trials for arousal disorders.

A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Over the past 4 weeks, how sa
ReferenceDocuments.description: Over the past 4 weeks, how satisfied were you with your ability to reach orgasm (climax) during sexual activity or intercourse?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring Manual Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure.
